United States Consumer Price Index / Periodic collection of prices was started, and in 1919 the Bureau of Labor Statistics began publication of separate indexes for 32 cities. During World War II, when many commodities were scarce and goods were rationed, the index weights were adjusted temporarily to reflect these shortages.
